intro: Phyllanthus lingulatus, commonly known as the Indian false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a small shrub that typically grows up to 1 meter in height, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. Phyllanthus lingulatus is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
